definition: to trace over/to copy (a calligraphy model)/facsimile/(fig.) to depict/to portray

sentences.english: The author tried to depict the splendor of the sunset.
sentences.chinese: 作家试图摹写落日的光彩。

sentences.english: Influenced by his teacher, he started counterdrawing the models of orchid-bamboo and landscape paintings.
sentences.chinese: 受塾师影响，开始摹写兰竹与山水。

sentences.english: She has just begun to learn calligraphy and can only use the practice paper to copy model characters.
sentences.chinese: 她刚开始学习书法，只能使用仿纸进行摹写。

sentences.english: As similar to《Fu Rong Nv Er Ji》, it is also the author pay efforts.
sentences.chinese: 它和《芙蓉女儿诔》一样，是作者出力摹写的文字。

sentences.english: Any or all of the signatures on the certificate may be facsimile.
sentences.chinese: 所有证明文件上的签名必须亲自摹写。

sentences.english: With his whole life, he spent most of the timeimitaing the style of the Chinese traditional paintings.
sentences.chinese: 三花费一生大部分的时间摹写传统的中国画风格。

sentences.english: Gnarled fingers trace the signature of warmth.
sentences.chinese: 苍凉的手指摹写温暖的留名。

definition: to copy (a model of calligraphy or painting)
to copy (a model of calligraphy or painting etc)
line drawing in traditional ink and brush style/simple and straightforward style of writing
variant of 摹寫|摹写[mo2 xie3]
to trace over/to take a copy (of a calligraphy, a painting etc)/(fig.) to describe/to portray
to bear a close resemblance to/to be the very image of
variant of 模擬|模拟[mo2 ni3]
to practice calligraphy from a model
a rubbing from a stone inscription
gongbi, traditional Chinese painting method characterized by meticulous brush technique and detailed description
freehand drawing or painting in traditional Chinese style
